basic.floral_language:
Graptosedum “Francesco Baldi”
Floriography: Gentle, generous, beautiful
Graptosedum “Francesco Baldi” looks like lotus flowers, leaves bigger than Graptopetalum 'Mirinae', oval shape with spine on the tip, green and smooth surface, turn pale pink when light is abundant, but not as colorful as Graptopetalum 'Mirinae'. Often used in small pot succulent combos for indoor decorations.
Graptosedum “Francesco Baldi” loves sunlight, but may be dormant in summer under high temperature, need reduce watering and sunlight exposure. Occasionally blooms with white slightly reddish flowers
basic.blooming: Succulent plants, sometimes flowers, white slightly red flowers
basic.color: Leaf color pale green, with adequate sunlight, leaves or whole plants turning to pale pink

maintenance.soil: Peat and akadama mixed in 3:1 ratio
maintenance.sunlight: Likes adequate sunshine, when in a short period of dormancy in summer, reduce water and shade properly
maintenance.watering: Do not water frequently, keep a dry environment, water every 7-10 days
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring and autumn
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered and dead leaves and excessive daughter plants
